en: He knew that when he returned to the firehouse, he might wink at himself, a minstrel man, burnt-corked, in the mirror. Later, going to sleep, he would feel the fiery smile still gripped by his face muscles, in the dark. It never went away, that. smile, it never ever went away, as long as he remembered.

es: Sabía que, cuando regresase al cuartel de bomberos, se miraría pestañeando en el espejo: su rostro sería el de un negro de opereta, tiznado con corcho ahumado. Luego, al irse a dormir, sentiría la fiera sonrisa retenida aún en la oscuridad por sus músculos faciales. Esa sonrisa nunca desaparecía, nunca había desaparecido hasta donde él podía recordar.

vi_translation: He knew that when he returned to the fire station, he might wink at himself, a wandering artist, as black as charred wood, in the mirror. After that, going to sleep, he would feel that fierce smile still held tight by his facial muscles, in the dark. It never completely disappeared, that smile, it never completely went away, as far as he could remember.
tr_translation: When he returned to the fire station, he knew that he would look in the mirror at his face, which had turned black like a burnt mushroom, and wink at himself. Later, as he fell asleep, he would feel the fiery smile his facial muscles had captured in the dark. As long as he remembered, that smile would never fade or disappear.
es_translation: He knew that, when he returned to the fire station, he would look at himself blinking in the mirror: his face would be that of a minstrel, blackened with smoked cork. Then, when he went to sleep, he would feel the fierce smile still held in the darkness by his facial muscles. That smile never disappeared, it had never disappeared as far back as he could remember.

en: “I sometimes think drivers don't know what grass is, or flowers, because they never see them slowly,” she said. “If you showed a driver a green blur, Oh yes! he'd say, that's grass! A pink blur? That's a rose-garden! White blurs are houses. Brown blurs are cows. My uncle drove slowly on a highway once. He drove forty miles an hour and they jailed him for two days. Isn't that funny, and sad, too?”

Las manchas pardas son vacas. Una vez, mi tío condujo lentamente por una carretera. Condujo a sesenta y cinco kilómetros por hora y lo encarcelaron por dos días. ¿No es curioso, y triste también?

vi_translation: "Sometimes I think those drivers don't know what grass or flowers are, because they never look at them slowly," she said. "If you show a driver a blur of green, oh yes, that's grass, he would say. A blur of pink? Well, that's a rose garden! Blurs of white are houses. Blurs of brown are cows. My uncle once drove slowly on the highway. He drove forty miles an hour, so they jailed him for two days. Isn't that funny, but also sad?"
tr_translation: “Sometimes I think drivers don't know what grass or flowers are. Because they never slow down to see them,” said Clarisse. “If you show them something green, they’ll say, ‘Oh yes, that's grass,’ If you show them something pink, they’ll say, ‘A rose garden,’ White shapes are buildings. Brown shapes are cows. My uncle once drove slowly on the highways. He drove the car at 40 miles per hour and they put him in jail for two days. Isn't it very funny and also sad?”
es_translation: —Sometimes, I think that their drivers don't know what grass or flowers look like, because they never see them closely —she said—. If you showed one of those drivers a blurry green spot, they would say: Oh, yes, it's grass! A blurry pink spot? It's a rose garden! The white spots are houses. The brown spots are cows. Once, my uncle drove slowly down a road. He drove at sixty-five kilometers per hour and was jailed for two days. Isn't it curious, and sad too?

Divehi (Dhivehi): ހަމަހިމޭންކަމާއެކު އެމީހުން ހިނގައިގަތީ ހިމޭންކަމާއެކުގައެވެ. އޭނާގެ ހިމޭންކަމާއި ނުތަނަވަސްކަމުގެ ހިމޭންކަމުގެ ސަބަބުން އޭނާ އެކަމަނާގެ މައްޗަށް ތުހުމަތުގެ ނަޒަރަކުން ބަލާލިއެވެ. އެއުރެން އެކަމަނާގެ ގެއާ ހަމަޔަށް އައިހިނދު، އެތަނުގެ ހުރިހާ އަލިކަމެއް އަލިވެގެން ދިޔައެވެ.

en: He glanced back at the wall. How like a mirror, too, her face. Impossible; for how many people did you know that refracted your own light to you? People were more often-he searched for a simile, found one in his work-torches, blazing away until they whiffed out. How rarely did other people's faces take of you and throw back to you your own expression, your own innermost trembling thought?

Con người ta thường là - anh tìm một hình ảnh so sánh, và tìm thấy trong công việc mình làm - những ngọn đuốc, cứ bùng cháy cho đến khi rụi hết. Bir benzetme aradı ve Montag kendi işinden buldu; insanlar daha çok bir meşaleye benziyorlardı; birileri üfleyinceye kadar yanarlardı. Ne kadar nadir diğer insanların yüzleri sizi sizden alıp, kendi duygularınızı, en derin titrek düşüncelerinizi size yansıtırdı?

es: Volvió a mirar la pared. El rostro de ella también se parecía mucho a un espejo. Imposible, ¿cuánta gente había que refractase hacia uno su propia luz? Por lo general, la gente era —Montag buscó un símil, lo encontró en su trabajo— como antorchas, que ardían hasta consumirse. ¡Cuán pocas veces los rostros de las otras personas captaban algo tuyo y te devolvían tu propia expresión, tus pensamientos más íntimos!
es_results: The passage provided seems to reflect themes and stylistic elements reminiscent of Ray Bradbury's "Fahrenheit 451." The mention of fire, the metaphor of people as torches burning until consumed, and the contemplation of how faces reflect one's own light back to them align with the novel's exploration of censorship, the suppression of knowledge, and the dehumanizing effects of a society that burns books.  Given these thematic and stylistic parallels, a plausible guess for the book and author would be:
vi_translation: He glanced back at the wall. It was also like a mirror, how similar, her face. Impossible; for how many people do we know who refract our own light back to us? People are often - he searched for a comparison, and found it in his work - like torches, burning until they are completely consumed. How rare it is when someone else's face captures us and reflects back our own expression, our deepest, trembling thoughts?
tr_translation: Montag glanced at the wall again. How much Clarisse's face resembled a mirror. Impossible; how many people do you know who reflect your light back to you? He searched for a metaphor and found one from his own work; people were more like torches; they burned until someone blew them out. How rare it was for other people's faces to take you away from yourself and reflect your own feelings, your deepest trembling thoughts back to you?
es_translation: He looked back at the wall. Her face also resembled a mirror very much. Impossible, how many people were there who refracted one's own light back at them? Generally, people were —Montag searched for a simile, found it in his work— like torches, burning until they consumed themselves. How rarely did the faces of other people capture something of yours and return your own expression, your most intimate thoughts!
Sesotho: 'Me o ile a sheba ka morao leboteng. Like a bone, like a face. e ke keng ea khoneha; Ke batho ba bakae bao u ba tsebang hore ba u fa leseli la hau? Batho ba ne ba atisa ho batla simile, ba fumana e 'ngoe ka har'a lirumula tsa hae tsa mosebetsi, e tukang mollo ho fihlela ba tsoa. Ke ka seoelo lifahleho tsa batho ba bang li ileng tsa u nka 'me li lahlela morao ho uena polelo ea hau, monahano oa hau o ka hare o thothomelang ka ho fetisisa?
Yorùbá: Ó wo ògiri náà sẹ́yìn. Báwo ni dígí, pẹ̀lú, ojú rẹ̀. Ko ṣee ṣe; fún iye ènìyàn mélòó ni o mọ̀ tí ó tún rákẹ́ẹ̀lé ìmọ́lẹ̀ ara rẹ fún ọ? Àwọn ènìyàn máa ń wá simile, wọ́n rí ọ̀kan nínú àwọn iná iṣẹ́ rẹ̀, tí ó ń jó lọ títí tí wọ́n fi jáde. Báwo ni ojú àwọn ènìyàn mìíràn ṣe ṣọ̀wọ́n tó láti gbà ọ́ tí wọ́n sì sọ ọ́ padà sí ọ̀dọ̀ rẹ, èrò ìbẹ̀rù inú rẹ?
Setswana (Tswana): A lebelela kwa morago mo loboteng. O tshwana le seipone sa gagwe. go sa kgonagale; Ke batho ba le kae ba ba neng ba itse gore o ne o dira tiro ya gago? Gantsi batho ba ne ba batla simile, ba fitlhela e le nngwe mo diruing tsa gagwe tsa go tshuba, go fitlha di fofa. Ke eng se se neng se dira gore batho ba bangwe ba go tshware mme ba go latlhele kwa go wena, tsela e o akanyang ka yone e e mo teng ga mogopolo wa gago o o neng o le mo teng ga gago?
Reo Tahiti (Tahitian): Ua hi'o faahou a'era oia i ni'a i te papa'i. E au atoa to ' na hoho'a mata i te hoê hi'o. Eita e nehenehe ; e hea rahiraa taata ta outou i ite o tei haamaramarama mai i to outou iho maramarama ? E mea pinepine te taata i te imi i te hoê pereoo, ua itehia ia'na te hoê i roto i ta'na mau apaparaa ohipa, e ua pohe e tae roa'tu i te taime ua pau ratou. Mea varavara roa te hoho'a mata o te tahi atu mau taata i te haru ia outou e i te faaho'i mai ia outou i ta outou iho parau, to outou iho mana'o ruru?
Maithili: ओ दीवार पर पाछू देखलक। कतेक दर्पण जकां अछि, ओकर चेहरा भी। असंभव; कतेक लोक के लेल अहां जनैत छी जे अहां के अपन प्रकाश अहां के अपवर्तित करैत अछि? लोकसभ बेसीकाल एकटा उपमा तकैत छलाह, अपन काज-मशालमे एकटा भेटलनि, जा धरि ओ बाहर नहि निकलि गेलाह ताबत धरि धधकैत रहलाह। कतेक कम आन लोकक चेहरा अहाँकेँ लऽ कऽ अहाँक अपन भाव, अहाँक अपन भीतरक काँपैत विचार अहाँकेँ फेकि दैत छल?
Malagasy: Nitodika tany amin'ny rindrina indray izy. Toy ny fitaratra ihany koa ny endriny. Tsy azo tanterahina; Fa firy ny olona fantatrao fa nahatonga ny fahazavanao ho anao? Matetika ny olona no nitady similemy, nahita iray tao anatin'ny fanilo asany, nirehidrehitra mandra-piposaky ny rano. Impiry moa ny endrik'olon-kafa no naka anao ary namerina taminao ny fomba fiteninao manokana, ny eritreritrao tena mangovitra indrindra?
Divehi (Dhivehi): އޭނާ ފަސްއެނބުރި ބަލާލީ ފާރަށެވެ. އައިރާއެއް ފަދައިން އޭނަގެ މޫނުވެސް ކިހިނެއް ހެއްޔެވެ؟ އިމްޕޮސިބަލް; ހަމަކަށަވަރުން، ތިޔަބައިމީހުންގެ އަމިއްލަ އަލިކަން ތިޔަބައިމީހުންނަށް އެނގުނީ ކިތައް މީހުންނަށް ހެއްޔެވެ؟ މީސްތަކުން ގިނަގިނައިން ހޯދަމުން ދިޔައެވެ. އެކަލޭގެފާނު އެކަލޭގެފާނުގެ މަސައްކަތްޕުޅުތަކުގެ ތެރެއިން އެކަކު ފެނިވަޑައިގަތެވެ. ފަހެ، އެކަލޭގެފާނު ނުކުމެވަޑައިގަންނަވަންދެން އަލިފާންރޯވެ އަނދައަނދާ ހުއްޓެވެ. އެހެން މީހުންގެ މޫނުތަކުން ތިބާގެ ކިބައިން ނަގައި، ތިބާގެ އަމިއްލަ އިޙްސާސްތަކާއި، ތިބާގެ އަމިއްލަ އެތެރޭގެ ތެޅިފޮޅެމުން ދިޔަ ވިސްނުން ތިޔަބައިމީހުންގެ ގާތަށް އުކާލީ ކިހާ މަދުން ހެއްޔެވެ؟

en: What incredible power of identification the girl had; she was like the eager watcher of a marionette show, anticipating each flicker of an eyelid, each gesture of his hand, each flick of a finger, the moment before it began. How long had they walked together? Three minutes? Five? Yet how large that time seemed now. How immense a figure she was on the stage before him; what a shadow she threw on the wall with her slender body! He felt that if his eye itched, she might blink. And if the muscles of his jaws stretched imperceptibly, she would yawn long before he would.

vi: Cô gái này có cái khả năng đồng hóa vào ngoại thể thật đáng kinh ngạc; nàng giống như người háo hức xem một buổi diễn múa rối, đoán trước được từng cái nháy mắt, từng cử động của bàn tay anh, từng cái nhúc nhích của một ngón tay, một khoảnh khắc trước khi nó bắt đầu. Họ đi cùng nhau được bao lâu nhỉ? Ba phút? Năm? Thế nhưng khoảng thời gian đó giờ đây có vẻ dài làm sao. Hình ảnh nàng mới rợn ngợp làm sao trên cái sân khấu trước mặt anh; và bóng nàng hắt lên tường mới to lớn làm sao so với thân hình mảnh dẻ của nàng! Anh cảm thấy nếu mắt anh ngứa, nàng sẽ chớp mắt. Và nếu các cơ hàm anh duỗi ra nhẹ đến không thể nhận thấy, nàng sẽ ngáp trước khi anh ngáp.

tr: Kızın ne inanılmaz bir tanımlama gücü vardı. Kukla gösterisini hoşlanarak izleyen birine benziyordu. Göz kapağının her kıpırdanışını, elinin her jestini, parmağının hafif dokunuşlarını daha başlamadan tahmin ediyordu. Ne kadar süre birlikte yürümüşlerdi? Üç dakika mı yoksa beş dakika mı? Çok uzun bir süre gibi geliyordu ona. Önündeki sahnede kocaman bir figür oluşturmuştu; o incecik bedeniyle duvara ne büyük bir gölge yansıtmıştı. Montag gözü kaşınsa, Clarisse’in gözlerini kırpıştıracağını hissediyordu. Fark edilmez bir şekilde çene kasları gerilseydi, Clarisse ondan önce esneyecekti.

es: Aquella muchacha tenía un increíble poder de identificación; era como el ávido espectador de una función de marionetas, previendo cada parpadeo, cada movimiento de una mano, cada estremecimiento de un dedo, un momento antes de que sucediese. ¿Cuánto rato habían caminado juntos? ¿Tres minutos? ¿Cinco? Sin embargo, ahora le parecía un rato interminable. ¡Qué inmensa figura tenía ella en el escenario que se extendía ante sus ojos! ¡Qué sombra producía en la pared con su esbelto cuerpo! Montag se dio cuenta de que, si le picasen los ojos, ella pestañearía. Y de que si los músculos de sus mandíbulas se tensaran imperceptiblemente, ella bostezaría mucho antes de que lo hiciera él.

Given the focus on observation and the suspenseful atmosphere, it could potentially fit within the narrative style of other
vi_translation: This girl has an incredible ability to assimilate into the external environment; she is like someone eagerly watching a puppet show, predicting every blink, every movement of his hand, every twitch of a finger, a moment before it begins. How long have they been together? Three minutes? Five? Yet that period now seems so long. How overwhelming her image is on the stage in front of him; and how large her shadow looms on the wall compared to her slender figure! He feels that if his eyes itch, she will blink. And if his jaw muscles stretch ever so slightly, she will yawn before he does.
tr_translation: The girl had an incredible power of description. She looked like someone who enjoyed watching a puppet show. She could predict every twitch of the eyelid, every gesture of the hand, every light touch of the finger before they even started. How long had they been walking together? Three minutes or five minutes? It felt like a very long time to him. In the scene before him, a huge figure had formed; with her slender body, she had cast a large shadow on the wall. Montag felt that if his eye itched, Clarisse would blink her eyes. If his jaw muscles tensed imperceptibly, Clarisse would yawn before him.
es_translation: That girl had an incredible power of identification; she was like the avid spectator of a puppet show, anticipating every blink, every hand movement, every finger twitch, a moment before it happened. How long had they walked together? Three minutes? Five? However, now it seemed like an endless time. What an immense figure she had on the stage that stretched out before his eyes! What a shadow she cast on the wall with her slender body! Montag realized that if his eyes itched, she would blink. And that if the muscles of his jaws tensed imperceptibly, she would yawn long before he did.
Sesotho: Ke matla afe a makatsang a ho khetholla ngoanana eo; O ne a tšoana le molebeli ea chesehang oa lenaneo la marionette, a lebelletse flicker e 'ngoe le e' ngoe ea leihlo, ketso e 'ngoe le e' ngoe ea letsoho la hae, setšoantšo se seng le se seng sa monoana, motsotso pele e qala. Ba ne ba lula hammoho nako e kae? Metsotso e meraro? Tse hlano? Empa nako eo e ne e bonahala e le khōlō hakaakang hona joale. O ne a le motle hakaakang ka pel'a hae; Ke moriti o kaakang oo a o lahlelang leboteng ka 'mele oa hae o mosesane! O ne a nahana hore haeba mahlo a hae a ne a thothomela, a ka 'na a panya. 'Me haeba mesifa ea mohlahare oa hae o ne a otlolle ka ho samperceptibly, o ne a tla be a ile a beoa nako e telele pele a e-ba teng.
Yorùbá: Kini agbara alaragbayida ti idanimọ ti ọmọbirin naa ni; Ó dàbí olùṣọ́ tí ó ní ìtara fún àfihàn marionette, ó ń retí ojú kọ̀ọ̀kan, ìwà ọwọ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan, fíìmù ìka kọ̀ọ̀kan, àkókò kí ó tó bẹ̀rẹ̀. Ìgbà wo ni wọ́n tí jọ rìn papọ̀ dà? Ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́ta? Márùn-ún? Síbẹ̀ bí àkókò yẹn ṣe tóbi tó báyìí. Bí ó ṣe tóbi tó lórí ìtàgé níwájú rẹ̀; Òjìji wo ni ó jù sórí ògiri pẹ̀lú ara rẹ̀ tí ó rẹ̀wẹ̀sì! Ó ní ìmọ̀lára pé tí ojú rẹ̀ bá dùn, ó lè fọ́nrán. Àti pé tí iṣan ẹ̀gbọ́n rẹ̀ bá gùn lọ́nà tí kò dára, yóò yọ̀ fún ìgbà pípẹ́ kí ó tó ṣe é.
Setswana (Tswana): ke nonofo efe e e gakgamatsang e e neng e na le maatla a mosadi yo o neng a na le yone; O ne a tshwana le molebedi yo o tlhagafetseng wa ga Marionette, a lebeletse leswana lengwe le lengwe la sefatlhego sa gagwe, le lengwe le le lengwe la seatla, le lengwe le le lengwe la monwana, motsotso pele le simolola. Ba ne ba nna mmogo lobaka lo lo kae? Metsotso e meraro Tlhano? Mme jaanong go ne go lebega go le thata jang ne go le kana kang? O ne a le mo setshwantshong se se kana kang fa pele ga gagwe! O ne a latlhela mo leboteng le le jang ne le le mo mpeng ya gagwe e e neng e le mo go yone! O ne a ikutlwa gore fa leitlho la gagwe le ne le sa ratwe, a ka nna a disitse. Mme fa mesifa ya gagwe e ne e sa senyege, e ne e tla bo e le nako e telele pele e ka bo e le teng.
Reo Tahiti (Tahitian): Auê ïa mana maere no te faaiteraa i te huru o taua tamahine ra ; ua riro oia mai te taata tiai ru o te hoê hoho'a marionette, ma te tiai i te mau tapao atoa o te hoê arumata, te mau tapao tataitahi o to ' na rima, te hoê hoho'a o te hoê rimarima, te taime na mua ' ' e oia e haamata ' i. Eaha te maororaa to raua haere-amui-raa ? E toru minuti? E pae? Tera râ, auê ïa te rahi o taua taime ra i teie nei. Auê ïa to'na rahi i ni'a i te tahua i mua ia'na ; auê ïa ata o ta ' na i taora i nia i te patu e to ' na tino pararai! Ua mana'o oia e mai te peu e mea mauiui to ' na mata, e amo paha oia i te mata. E mai te peu e e aano roa te mau uaua i'o o to ' na taa, e tupaipai oia i to ' na vaha na mua roa ' ' e oia e na reira ' i.
Maithili: लड़की के पहचान के कतेक अविश्वसनीय शक्ति छलइ; ओ एकटा मैरियोनेट शोक उत्सुक देखनिहार जकाँ छलीह, पलकक प्रत्येक झिलमिलाहट, हुनक हाथक प्रत्येक हावभाव, अंगुरीक प्रत्येक झटका, शुरू होयबासँ एक क्षण पहिने अनुमान लगा रहल छलीह। कतेक काल धरि ओ सभ एक संग चलि रहल छलाह? तीन मिनट? पाँच? तइयो ओ समय आब कतेक पैघ लगैत छल। हुनकासँ पहिने मंच पर ओ कतेक विशाल आकृति छलीह; ओ अपन पतला शरीर सं दीवार पर कतेक छाया फेंकि देलखिन! हुनका लगलनि जे जँ हुनक आँखिमे खुजली होयत तँ ओ पलक झपकि सकैत छथि। आ जँ हुनक जबड़ा के मांसपेशी अबोध रूप सँ पसरल रहैत छल, तऽ ओ हुनका सँ बहुत पहिने जम्हाई दैत छलीह।
Malagasy: Inona no hery mahagaga ny famantarana ny zazavavy nanana; Toy ny mpanara-maso mavitrika ny fampisehoana Marionette izy, niandry ny flicker tsirairay amin'ny hodimaso, ny fihetsika tsirairay avy amin'ny tanany, ny rantsan-tanana tsirairay, ny fotoana talohan'ny nanombohan'izany. Hafiriana no niarahan'izy ireo? Telo minitra? Dimy ? Kanefa toa tahaka ny ahoana ny halehiben'izany fotoana izany. Akory ny halehiben'ny tarehiny teo amin'ny lampihazo teo anoloany; Aloka natsipiny teo amin'ny rindrina niaraka tamin'ny vatany manify! Nihevitra izy fa mety hipi-maso raha toa ka mipi-maso izy. Ary raha toa ka mihitatra tsy hita maso ny hozatry ny valanoranony, dia ho ela alohan'ny hanaovany izany izy.
Divehi (Dhivehi): އެ އަންހެން ކުއްޖާ ދެނެގަތުމުގެ ކިހާ ބޮޑު ބާރެއް ހެއްޔެވެ؟ އެކަމަނާ އަކީ މެރިއޮނެޓް ޝޯއެއްގެ ޝައުޤުވެރިކަން ހުރި މީހަކު ފަދައިންނެވެ. ލޮލުގެ ކޮންމެ ފިނިފެންމަލަކާއި، އަތުގެ ކޮންމެ އިޝާރާތަކާއި، އިނގިލީގެ ކޮންމެ އިޝާރާތަކާއި، އިނގިލީގެ ކޮންމެ ފިނިކަމެއް، އެ ޝޯ ފެށުމުގެ ކުރީގައިވާ ހިނދުކޮޅަކަށެވެ. އެދެމީހުން އެކުގައި ހިނގާފައި ދިޔައީ ކިހާ އިރަކު ހެއްޔެވެ؟ ތިން މިނިޓް؟ ފަސް؟ ނަމަވެސް އެ ވަގުތު މިހާރު ހީވީ ކިހާ ބޮޑުކޮށެވެ. އޭނާގެ ކުރިމަތީގައި ހުރި ސްޓޭޖުގައި އެކަމަނާ ހުންނެވީ ކިހާ ބޮޑު ސިފައެއް ހެއްޔެވެ؟ އޭނާގެ ތުނި ހަށިގަނޑާއެކު ފާރުމައްޗަށް އެއްލާލީ ކޮންފަދަ ހިޔަނިއެއް ހެއްޔެވެ؟ އޭނާގެ ލޮލުގައި ރިއްސާނަމަ ލޮލުގައި ފިރުމާލެވިދާނެކަމުގެ އިހުސާސް އޭނާއަށް ކުރެވުނެވެ. އަދި އެކަލޭގެފާނުގެ ޖަވާހިރުތަކުގެ މަސްތައް، އެކަލޭގެފާނުގެ ކަނދުރާގެ މަސްތައް ނުހަނު ދިގުވެއްޖެނަމަ، އެކަމަނާ އެކަލޭގެފާނުގެ އަރިހުގައި ހިނިތުންވެވަޑައިގަންނަވާނެތެވެ.

en: It was like coming into the cold marbled room of a mausoleum after the moon had set. Complete darkness, not a hint of the silver world outside, the windows tightly shut, the chamber a tomb-world where no sound from the great city could penetrate. The room was not empty.

es: Era como entrar en la fría sala de un mausoleo después de haberse puesto la luna. Oscuridad completa, ni un atisbo del plateado mundo exterior; las ventanas herméticamente cerradas convertían la habitación en un mundo de ultratumba en el que no podía penetrar ningún ruido de la gran ciudad. La habitación no estaba vacía.

vi_translation: It was like stepping into a cold marble room of a tomb after the moon had set. Pitch dark, with nothing hinting at the silver world outside, the windows tightly shut, the secluded room belonging to a crypt where no sound from the bustling city outside could penetrate. The room was not empty.
tr_translation: After the moon disappeared, it was like entering the cold marble chamber of a mausoleum. In the completely dark environment, there was no trace of the silver world outside; the windows were so tightly shut that the noise of the big city couldn't penetrate into the room, which was like a tomb. The room was not empty.
es_translation: It was like entering the cold hall of a mausoleum after the moon had set. Complete darkness, not a hint of the silvery outside world; the hermetically sealed windows turned the room into an underworld where no noise from the great city could penetrate. The room was not empty.
Sesotho: Ho ne ho tšoana le ho kena ka kamoreng e batang ea marbled ea mausoleum ka mor'a hore khoeli e beoe. Lefifi le felletseng, eseng maikutlo a lefats'e la silevera kantle, lifensetere li koetsoe ka thata, kamore e le lefats'e la mabitla moo ho seng molumo o tsoang toropong e kholo e ka kenang. Kamore e ne e se na letho.
Yorùbá: Ó dàbí wíwá sínú yàrá marbled tútù ti ibojì lẹ́yìn tí òṣùpá ti ṣètò. Òkùnkùn pátápátá, kì í ṣe àmì ayé fàdákà níta, àwọn fèrèsé ti pa dáadáa, yàrá náà jẹ́ ayé ibojì níbi tí kò sí ohùn láti ìlú ńlá tí ó lè wọlé. Yàrá náà kò ṣófo.

Reo Tahiti (Tahitian): Mai te huru ra e te haere maira oia i roto i te piha toetoe o te hoê menema i muri a'e i te toparaa te ava'e. Malagasy: Toy ny hoe niditra tao amin'ny efitrano mangatsiaka misy ny mausoleum taorian'ny volana izany. Tsy nisy na inona na inona tao amin'ilay efitrano.

en: The room was cold but nonetheless he felt he could not breathe. He did not wish to open the curtains and open the french windows, for he did not want the moon to come into the room. So, with the feeling of a man who will die in the next hour for lack of air,.he felt his way toward his open, separate, and therefore cold bed.

es: La habitación era fresca; sin embargo, Montag sintió que no podía respirar. No quería correr las cortinas y abrir los ventanales, porque no deseaba que la luna penetrara en el cuarto. Por lo tanto, con la sensación de un hombre que ha de morir en menos de una hora, por falta de aire que respirar, se dirigió a tientas hacia su cama abierta, separada y, en consecuencia fría.

vi_translation: The room was cold, yet he still felt like he couldn't breathe. He didn't want to draw the curtains and open the French windows because he didn't want the moonlight to flood the room. So, with the feeling that he was like someone who would die from lack of air in an hour, he groped his way towards his empty, isolated, and therefore cold bed.
tr_translation: The room was cold, yet Montag felt he couldn't breathe comfortably. He didn't feel like opening the curtains and blinds because he didn't want the moonlight to enter the room. An hour later, feeling like a man who would die from lack of air, he moved towards his open, separate, and therefore cold bed.
es_translation: The room was cool; however, Montag felt that he couldn't breathe. He didn't want to draw the curtains and open the windows, because he didn't want the moon to enter the room. Therefore, with the feeling of a man who is to die in less than an hour due to lack of air to breathe, he groped his way towards his open, separated, and consequently cold bed.
Sesotho: Kamore e ne e bata, empa o ne a sa khone ho hema. O ne a sa lakatse ho bula likharetene le ho bula lifensetere tsa Fora, hobane o ne a sa batle hore khoeli e kene ka kamoreng. Kahoo, ka maikutlo a monna ea tla shoa ka hora e latelang bakeng sa ho hloka moea, o ile a ikutloa a lebile bulehileng hae, a arohana, 'me ka hona a bata bethe.
Yorùbá: Yàrá náà tutù ṣùgbọ́n síbẹ̀síbẹ̀ ó rò pé òun kò lè mí. Kò fẹ́ ṣí aṣọ ìkọ́rí náà kí ó sì ṣí fèrèsé Faransé, nítorí kò fẹ́ kí òṣùpá wá sínú yàrá náà. Nítorí náà, pẹ̀lú ìmọ̀lára ọkùnrin kan tí yóò kú ní wákàtí tó ń bọ̀ fún àìní afẹ́fẹ́,.ó ní ìmọ̀lára ọ̀nà rẹ̀ sí ìṣísílẹ̀ rẹ̀, ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, àti nítorí náà ibùsùn tútù.
Setswana (Tswana): Go ne go le tsididi thata mme o ne a ikutlwa a sa kgone go hema. O ne a sa batle go bula dikgara le go bula difensetere tsa Fora, ka a ne a sa batle gore ngwedi o tsene mo phaposing. Ka jalo, ka nako ya fa motho a swa ka ura e e latelang, o ne a sa tlhoke moya, a ikutlwa a le mo tseleng ya gagwe e e bulegileng, a kgaogana, a bo a le mo bolaong jo bo tsididi.
Reo Tahiti (Tahitian): E mea to'eto'e roa te piha, tera râ, ua mana'o oia e, eita ta'na e nehenehe e huti i te aho. Aita oia i hinaaro ia iriti i te mau paruru e ia iriti i te mau haamaramarama, no te mea aita oia i hinaaro ia tomo mai te ava'e i roto i te piha. No reira, na roto i te mana'o o te hoê taata o te pohe i te hora i muri mai no te ereraa i te mata'i, ua ite oia i to'na e'a e tae atu ai i to'na ro'i mahora, e te to'eto'e e te to'eto'e.
Maithili: कोठरी ठंढा छल मुदा तइयो हुनका लगलनि जे ओ सांस नहि लऽ सकैत छथि। ओ पर्दा खोलय आ फ्रेंच खिड़की खोलय नहि चाहैत छलाह, किएक तँ ओ नहि चाहैत छलाह जे चन्द्रमा कोठरीमे आबि जाय। तेँ एकटा एहन आदमीक भावनाक सङ्ग जे अगिला घंटामे हवाक अभावमे मरि जायत,.ओ अपन खुला, अलग, आ तेँ ठंढा बिछौना दिस अपन रास्ता अनुभव कयलनि।
Malagasy: Nangatsiaka ilay efitrano saingy na izany aza dia nahatsapa izy fa tsy afaka niaina. Tsy te hamoha ny ridao izy ary hanokatra ny varavarankely frantsay, satria tsy tiany hiditra ao amin'ilay efitrano ny volana. Noho izany, miaraka amin'ny fahatsapana lehilahy iray izay ho faty amin'ny ora manaraka noho ny tsy fahampian'ny rivotra, dia nahatsapa ny lalany mankany amin'ny fandriana misokatra, misaraka ary noho izany mangatsiaka izy.

en: “But most of all,” she said, “I like to watch people. Sometimes I ride the subway all day and look at them and listen to them. I just want to figure out who they are and what they want and where they're going. Sometimes I even go to the Fun Parks and ride in the jet cars when they race on the edge of town at midnight and the police don't care as long as they're insured. As long as everyone has ten thousand insurance everyone's happy. Sometimes I sneak around and listen in subways. Or I listen at soda fountains, and do you know what?”

es: Pero por encima de todo —prosiguió diciendo Clarisse—, me gusta observar a la gente. A veces, me paso el día entero en el «Metro», y los contemplo y los escucho. Sólo deseo saber qué son, qué desean y adónde van. A veces, incluso voy a los parques de atracciones y monto en los coches cohetes cuando recorren los arrabales de la ciudad a medianoche y la Policía no se mete con ellos con tal de que estén asegurados. tr_translation: “But most of all,” said Clarisse, “I love watching people. Sometimes I ride the subway all day, looking at them and listening to them. I just want to guess who they are, what they want, and where they are going. Sometimes I go to the amusement park and ride the jet cars at midnight on the outskirts of the city. As long as they are insured, the police don't care much. As long as everyone has a ten-thousand-dollar insurance, everyone is happy with their life. Sometimes I wander and listen to people on the subways. Or I listen at the snack bars, and do you know what?”
es_translation: But above all — Clarisse continued saying —, I like to observe people. Sometimes, I spend the whole day in the "Metro," and I watch them and listen to them. I just want to know what they are, what they want, and where they are going. Sometimes, I even go to amusement parks and ride the rocket cars when they go through the outskirts of the city at midnight and the Police don't bother them as long as they are insured. As long as everyone has a ten-thousand insurance, everyone is happy. Sometimes, I sneak in and listen in the "Metro." Or in the cafes. And, you know what?
Sesotho: O ile a re: "Empa ho feta moo, ke rata ho shebella batho. Ka linako tse ling ke palama metro letsatsi lohle mme ke li sheba ebe kea li mamela. Hafeela motho e mong le e mong a e-na le inshorense ea 10,000 e thabileng. Ka linako tse ling ke lula fatše le ho mamela li-metrobus. Kapa ke utloa liliba tsa soda, 'me na ua tseba hore na ke eng?
Yorùbá: "Ṣùgbọ́n ju gbogbo rẹ̀ lọ," ó sọ, "Mo fẹ́ràn láti máa wo àwọn ènìyàn. Nígbà mìíràn mo máa ń gun ọkọ̀ ojú irin ní gbogbo ọjọ́ mo sì máa ń wò wọ́n kí n sì tẹ́tí sí wọn. Mo kàn fẹ́ mọ irú ẹni tí wọ́n jẹ́ àti ohun tí wọ́n fẹ́ àti ibi tí wọ́n ń lọ. Níwọ̀n ìgbà tí gbogbo ènìyàn bá ti ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́wàá ìdánilójú inú gbogbo ènìyàn dùn. Nígbà mìíràn mo máa ń yọ́ kiri mo sì máa ń tẹ́tí sí àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú irin. Fa mongwe le mongwe a na le 10 000 000 ya inshorense e e itumedisang. Ka dinako tse dingwe ke ne ke ya go reetsa le go reetsa kwa mafelong a a kwa kgakala. Kana ke utlwa mo diseding tsa sopo, mme o itse eng?"

Divehi (Dhivehi): "އެކަމަކު އެންމެ ބޮޑަށް ލޯބިވަނީ މީހުން ބަލަން" އަރްސަލް ބުނެލިއެވެ. ބައެއް ފަހަރު މުޅި ދުވަހު ސަބްވޭގައި ދުއްވާފައި ގޮސް އެމީހުންނާ ދިމާލަށް ބަލަހައްޓައިގެން އަޑުއަހަމެވެ. އަހަރެން ބޭނުމީ އެއީ ކާކުކަމާއި އެމީހުން ބޭނުންވަނީ ކޮންބައެއްތޯ އާއި އެމީހުން ދަނީ ކޮންތަނަކަށްތޯ ބެލުމަށެވެ. ބައެއް ފަހަރު އަހަރެން ފަން ޕާކްތަކަށް ގޮސް ޖެޓް ކާރުތަކުގައި ދުވަނީ ރޭގަނޑު ދަންވަރު ރަށުގެ އައްސޭރިފަށުގައި ދުވާއިރު، އިންޝުއަރެންސް ކުރާހާ ހިނދަކު ފުލުހުން އެކަމާ ފަރުވާލެއް ނުބަހައްޓައެވެ. ކޮންމެ މީހަކަށް ވެސް ދިހަހާސް އިންޝުއަރެންސް ލިބޭހާ ހިނދަކު އެންމެން ވެސް ތިބީ އުފަލުންނެވެ. ބައެއް ފަހަރު ސިއްރުން ވަށައިގެން ސަބްވޭތަކުގައި އަޑުއަހަމެވެ. ނުވަތަ ސޯޑާ ފައުންޓޭންތަކުގައި އަހަރެން އަޑުއަހަމެވެ. އަދި ކަލެއަށް އެނގޭހެއްޔެވެ؟

en: So it was the hand that started it all. He felt one hand and then the other work his coat free and let it slump to the floor. He held his pants out into an abyss and let them fall into darkness. His hands had been infected, and soon it would be his arms. He could feel the poison working up his wrists and into his elbows and his shoulders, and then the jump-over from shoulder-blade to shoulder-blade like a spark leaping a gap. His hands were ravenous. And his eyes were beginning to feel hunger, as if they must look at something, anything, everything.

es: De modo que era la mano que lo había empezado todo. Sintió una mano y, luego, la otra que desabrochaba su chaqueta y la dejaba caer en el suelo. Sostuvo sus pantalones sobre un abismo y los dejó caer en la oscuridad. Sus manos estaban hambrientas. Y sus ojos empezaban a estarlo también, como si tuviera necesidad de ver algo, cualquier cosa, todas las cosas.

vi_translation: So it was the very hands that started it all. He felt one hand, then the other, take off his coat and let it drop to the floor. He extended the pants he was wearing into an abyss and let them fall into the darkness. His hands were infected, and soon his arms would be too. He could feel the poison spreading up his wrists, into his elbows and shoulders, then leaping from one shoulder to the other like a spark jumping across a gap. His hands were ravenously hungry. And his eyes began to feel hungry, as if they had to see something, anything, everything.
tr_translation: It was the hand that started everything. First, he noticed one hand, then the other, opening and taking off his coat, and dropping it to the ground. He took off his pants and threw them into the darkness of hell. His hands were infected, and soon it would spread to his arms. He could feel the poison advancing from his wrists to his elbows, to his shoulders, leaping like a spark from one shoulder blade to the other. His hands were monstrously hungry. His gaze was also starting to hunger, as if they had to look at something, anything, everything.

Sesotho: Ke ka hona letsoho le qalileng ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe. O ile a ikutloa ka letsoho le leng eaba e mong o sebetsa seaparo sa hae mahala 'me a se tlohella hore se theohe fatše. 'Me o ile a beha borikhoe ba hae ka mohohlong' me a ba lumella hore ba oele lefifing. Matsoho a hae a ne a tšoaelitsoe, 'me haufinyane e tla ba matsoho a hae. O ne a ka utloa chefo e sebetsang matsohong a hae le ka har'a mahetla a hae, ebe o tlolela ho tloha lehetleng ho ea lehetleng ho ea lehetleng joalo ka ho tlola lekhalo. Matsoho a hae e ne e le raba. 'Me mahlo a hae a qala ho ikutloa tlala, joalokaha eka ba tlameha ho sheba ntho e itseng, eng kapa eng, ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe.
Yorùbá: Nítorí náà ọwọ́ ni ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ gbogbo rẹ̀. Ó ní ìmọ̀lára ọwọ́ kan lẹ́yìn náà èkejì ṣiṣẹ́ aṣọ rẹ̀ lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́ kí ó sì jẹ́ kí ó ṣubú sí ilẹ̀. Ó mú ṣòkòtò rẹ̀ jáde sínú ọ̀gbun àìnísàlẹ̀, ó sì jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣubú sínú òkùnkùn. Ọwọ́ rẹ̀ ti kó àrùn náà, láìpẹ́ yóò jẹ́ apá rẹ̀. Ó lè ní ìmọ̀lára májèlé náà tí ó ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí ọwọ́ ọwọ́ rẹ̀ àti sínú ìgbọ̀nwọ́ rẹ̀ àti èjìká rẹ̀, lẹ́yìn náà fífò láti abẹ́ èjìká sí abẹ́ èjìká bí ìmọ́lẹ̀ tí ó ń fò àlàfo. Ọwọ́ rẹ̀ jẹ́ ẹlẹ́rìndòdò. Àti pé ojú rẹ̀ ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní rí ebi, bí ẹni pé wọ́n gbọ́dọ̀ wo nkan kan, ohunkóhun, gbogbo nkan.
Setswana (Tswana): That's a hand ya gonna started. O ne a ikutlwa a le mongwe, mme yo mongwe a dira tiro ya gagwe ya go mo thusa gore a se ka a ya kwa tlase. O ne a tsenya difika tsa gagwe mo sefikaleng mme a di tsenya mo lefifing. Matsoho a hae a ne a tshwaetswa, mme haufinyane e tla ba matsoho a hae. O ne a ka nna a ikutlwa a le mo gare ga ditshika tsa gagwe le mo mabogong a gagwe, mme morago ga moo go tswa mo legetleng go ya kwa legetleng go ya kwa legetleng go ya kwa morago. Matsoho a hae a ne a le makgwakgwa. Mme matlho a gagwe a ne a simolola go ikutlwa ke tlala, jaaka e kete o tshwanetse go leba sengwe, sengwe le sengwe, sengwe le sengwe.
Reo Tahiti (Tahitian): No reira, na te rima i haamata i te taato'araa. Ua ite oia i te hoê rima e i muri iho ua tuu i to'na pereue i ni'a i te tahua. Ua faatoro oia i to ' na piripou avae roa i roto i te abuso e ua vaiiho ia ratou ia topa i roto i te pouri. Ua peehia to'na na rima, e aita i maoro roa ua riro te reira ei rima no'na. Ua nehenehe ia'na ia ite i te raau ta'ero i te fatiraa i ni'a i to'na na rima e i roto i to'na na poro rima e to'na tapono, e i muri iho, te ou'araa mai te tapono e tae atu i te tapono mai te hoê ou'araa i ni'a i te tapono. Ua mutumutu to'na na rima. E te haamata ra to'na na mata i te ite i te po'ia, mai te huru ra e, e ti'a ia ratou ia hi'o i te hoê mea, i te mau mea atoa.
Maithili: त इ हाथ छल जे इ सब शुरू केलक। हुनका लगलनि जे एकटा हाथ आ फेर दोसर हाथ अपन कोटकेँ मुक्त कऽ देलक आ ओकरा फर्श पर खसि पड़य देलक। ओ अपन पैन्टकेँ एकटा रसातलमे पकड़ि अन्हारमे पड़य देलनि। हुनक हाथ संक्रमित भऽ गेल छल, आ जल्दिये ई हुनक बांहि भऽ जायत। ओ अपन कलाई आ कोहनी आ काँधमे जहर काज करैत अनुभव कऽ सकैत छलाह, आ तखन कंध-ब्लेडसँ कंध-ब्लेड धरि कूदबाक अनुभव कऽ सकैत छलाह जेना चिंगारी एकटा अन्तरालकेँ उछलैत अछि। ओकर हाथ उग्र छल। आ ओकर आंखि मे भूख लगय लागल छल, जेना ओकरा किछु, किछु, सब किछु देखबाक चाही।
Malagasy: Ny tanana no nanomboka izany rehetra izany. Tsapany ny tanana iray ary avy eo ny iray hafa dia niasa ny palitaony malalaka ary namela izany hianjera amin'ny tany. Napetrany tao amin'ny lavaka mangitsokitsoka ny patalohany ary navelany ho latsaka tao amin'ny haizina izy ireo. Voan'ny aretina ny tanany, ary tsy ela dia ho sandriny izany. Afaka nahatsapa ilay poizina niasa teo amin'ny hatotanany sy teo amin'ny kihony sy ny sorony izy, ary avy eo dia nitsambikina avy teo amin'ny sorokany ka hatrany amin'ny soroka, toy ny pitik'afo mitsambikina amin'ny banga. Ny tanany dia feno habibiana. Ary nanomboka nahatsapa hanoanana ny masony, toy ny hoe tsy maintsy mijery zavatra, na inona na inona, ny zava-drehetra.
Divehi (Dhivehi): އެހެންކަމުން އެ ހުރިހާ ކަމެއް ފެށުނީ އެ އަތުންނެވެ. އެއްއަތް އިހުސާސްކުރެވުނީ އަނެއް އަތުން އޭނާގެ ކޯޓް ފްރީކޮށް މަސައްކަތްކޮށް ބިންމައްޗަށް ވެއްޓުމަށް ދޫކޮށްލުމަށެވެ. އޭނާ އޭނާގެ ޕެންޓް އަޑިގަނޑަކަށް ހިފަހައްޓައިގެން އަނދިރީގެ ތެރެއަށް ވެއްޓުމަށް ދޫކޮށްލިއެވެ. އޭނާގެ ދެއަތް ވަނީ ބަލިޖެހިފައެވެ. އަދި ވަރަށް އަވަހަށް އެއީ އޭނާގެ ދެއަތްތިލައެވެ. އެ ވިހަ އޭނާގެ ކަނދުރާއާއި ކަނދުރާއާއި ކަނދުރާގެ ތެރެއަށް މަސައްކަތްކުރަމުން ދިޔަކަމުގެ އިހުސާސް އޭނާއަށް ކުރެވުނެވެ. ދެން ކަނދުރާގެ ބްލޭޑުން ކަނދުރާގެ ބްލޭޑަށް ޖަމްޕް-އޯވާ އިހުސާސްކުރެވެނީ ފަރަގެއް ފަޅައިގެން ދިޔަ ސްޕާކެއް ފަދައިންނެވެ. އޭނާގެ ދެއަތް ތިލަވެގެން ދިޔައެވެ. އޭނާގެ ދެލޮލުން ބަނޑުހައިހޫނުކަން އިހުސާސްވާން ފެށީ ކޮންމެވެސް ކަމަކާއި ކޮންމެވެސް ކަމަކާއި ކޮންމެ ވެސް ކަމަކަށް ބަލަން ޖެހޭ ފަދައިންނެވެ.

en: Wasn't there an old joke about the wife who talked so much on the telephone that her desperate husband ran out to the nearest store and telephoned her to ask what was for dinner? Well, then, why didn't he buy himself an audio-Seashell broadcasting station and talk to his wife late at night, murmur, whisper, shout, scream, yell? But what would he whisper, what would he yell? What could he say?

es: ¿No había un viejo chiste acerca de la mujer que hablaba tanto por teléfono que su esposo, desesperado, tuvo que correr a la tienda más próxima para telefonearle y preguntar qué había para la cena? Bueno, entonces, ¿por qué no se compraba él una emisora para radio auricular y hablaba con su esposa ya avanzada la noche, murmurando, susurrando, gritando, vociferando? Pero, ¿qué le susurraría, qué le chillaría? ¿Qué hubiese podido decirle?

vi_translation: Isn't there an old joke about the wife talking on the phone so much that the desperate husband has to run to the nearest store to call her and ask what's for dinner? Well, why doesn't he just get himself a Shell transmitter and talk to her every night, mumbling, whispering, shouting, screaming, howling. But what would he whisper, what would he howl? What could he say?
tr_translation: There is an old joke; the man's wife talked on the phone so much that the desperate husband ran to the nearest shop and asked his wife over the phone what was for dinner that evening? Well then, why didn't he get a headset and talk to his wife by murmuring, whispering, shouting, and yelling through a radio channel late at night? But what would he whisper, what would he shout? What could he say?
es_translation: Wasn't there an old joke about the woman who talked so much on the phone that her husband, desperate, had to run to the nearest store to call her and ask what was for dinner? Well, then, why didn't he buy himself a radio transmitter and talk to his wife late into the night, murmuring, whispering, shouting, yelling? But, what would he whisper to her, what would he shout? What could he have told her?
Sesotho: Na ha ho na metlae ea khale ka mosali ea neng a bua haholo ka mohala oo monna oa hae ea tsielehileng a mathela lebenkeleng le haufi mme a mo fouela ho botsa hore na lijo tsa mantsiboea ke eng? Ke hobane'ng ha a sa ka a reka seteishene sa phatlalatso sa audio-Seashell mme a bua le mosali oa hae bosiu, ho korotla, ho lla, ho hoeletsa? Empa o ne a tla hoeletsa, o ne a tla re'ng? O ka re'ng?
Yorùbá: Ṣé àwàdà àtijọ́ kò sí nípa ìyàwó tí ó sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ débi pé ọkọ rẹ̀ tí ìjákulẹ̀ rẹ̀ sáré jáde lọ sí ilé ìtajà tó súnmọ́ jùlọ ó sì pe ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ láti béèrè ohun tí ó wà fún oúnjẹ alẹ́? Ó dáa, nígbà náà, kí ló dé tí kò ra ibùdó ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ ohùn Seashell fún ara rẹ̀ kí ó sì bá ìyàwó rẹ̀ sọ̀rọ̀ ní alẹ́, ẹkún, sísọ̀rọ̀ kéékèèké, kígbe, kígbe? Ṣùgbọ́n kí ni yóò sọ kẹ́lẹ́kẹ́lẹ́, kí ni ó máa pariwo? Kí ni ó lè sọ?
Setswana (Tswana): A ga go na metlae ya bogologolo ka mosadi yo o neng a bua thata mo mogaleng wa gagwe yo o neng a le gaufi le ene a ya kwa lebenkeleng le le gaufi le ene mme a mo founela go mmotsa gore dijo tsa maitseboa ke eng? Ke ka ntlha yang fa a ne a sa kgone go bua le mosadi wa gagwe bosigo, a bua le mosadi wa gagwe bosigo, a lela, a goa, a goa? Mme o ne a tla reng fa a ne a bua, o ne a tla goeletsa eng? O ne a ka bua eng?
Reo Tahiti (Tahitian): Aita anei e parau hauti tahito no nia i te vahine o tei paraparau rahi na roto i te niuniu paraparau e ua horo ta ' na tane e hepohepo ra i te fare toa piri roa ' ' e e ua taniuniu ia ' na no te ani e eaha te maa no te tamaaraa? No reira, no te aha aita oia i hoo mai ia'na iho i te hoê vahi haapurororaa faaroo e a paraparau ai i ta'na vahine i te maororaa pô, ma te amuamu, te muhumuhu, te tuô, te tuô, te tuô ? Eaha râ ta ' na e parau mǎrû mai, eaha ta ' na e tuô? Eaha ta ' na e nehenehe e parau?
Maithili: की ओहि पत्नीक विषयमे कोनो पुरान चुटकुला नहि छल जे टेलीफोन पर एतेक गप्प करैत छलीह जे ओकर हताश पति नजदीकी दोकान दिस दौड़ि गेलाह आ टेलीफोन कऽ पूछलनि जे रात्रिभोजक लेल की अछि? खैर, तखन, ओ अपन लेल एकटा ऑडियो-सीशेल प्रसारण स्टेशन किएक नहि किनलनि आ देर राति अपन पत्नीसँ गप्प किएक नहि कयलनि, बड़बड़ाइत, फुसफुसाइत, चिल्लाइत, चिल्लाइत, चिकरबैत किएक नहि कयलनि? मुदा ओ की फुसफुसाइत, की चिकरत? ओ की कहि सकैत छल?
Malagasy: Tsy nisy ve ny vazivazy taloha momba ilay vehivavy izay niresaka betsaka tamin'ny finday ka nihazakazaka tany amin'ny fivarotana akaiky indrindra ny vadiny izay kivy ary niantso azy an-tariby mba hanontany azy hoe inona no sakafo hariva? tr_translation: “‘We can never know the exact moment a friendship begins. Just like a vessel filling drop by drop, eventually, a single drop makes it overflow. In the same way, at the end of a series of kindnesses, there comes one final kindness that fills and overflows the human heart.’”

Malagasy: Tsy afaka milaza ny fotoana marina niforonan'ny finamanana isika. Toy ny famenoana ny rano indray mitete ny sambo, dia misy rano indray mitete ihany amin'ny farany, ka ao anatin'ny andiana hatsaram-panahy dia misy farany izay mahatonga ny fo hihazakazaka.'"
Divehi (Dhivehi): - "އެކުވެރިކަން އުފެދޭ ސީދާ ވަގުތެއް ބުނެދެވޭކަށް ނެތެވެ. ހަމަކަށަވަރުން، އުޅަނދެއް ތިރިޔަށް ފުރުމުގައި، އެންމެ ފަހުން އެ އުޅަނދު ފަޅައިގެންދާ ފަދައިން، އެ އުޅަނދެއްގެ މައްޗަށް ތިރިއެއް ވެއެވެ. ފަހެ، އޯގާތެރިކަމުގެ ސިލްސިލާއެއްގައި، އެންމެފަހުން ހިތުގެ ވިންދު ފަޅައިގެން ދެއެވެ."

en: “Number one: Do you know why books such as this are so important? Because they have quality. And what does the word quality mean? To me it means texture. This book has pores. It has features. This book can go under the microscope. You'd find life under the glass, streaming past in infinite profusion. The more pores, the more truthfully recorded details of life per square inch you can get on a sheet of paper, the more `literary' you are. That's my definition, anyway. Telling detail. Fresh detail. The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies.
en_results: "title": "The Catcher in the Rye","author": "J.D. Salinger"
vi: "Thứ nhất: Anh có biết vì sao nhũng cuốn sách như thế này lại quan trọng đến thế không? Vì chúng có phẩm chất. Và từ phẩm chất có nghĩa là gì? Với tôi nó có nghĩa là kết cấu. Sách này có những lỗ chân lông. Nó có những đặc tính. Sách này có thể cho vào dưới kính hiển vi. Anh sẽ tìm thấy sự sống dưới ống kính, tuôn chảy, tràn trề vô tận. Càng có nhiều lỗ chân lông, chi tiết sự sống trên từng phân vuông mà ta có thể ghi nhận trên một tờ giấy lại càng chân thật hơn, anh lại càng 'có chữ' hơn. Dù sao thì đó là định nghĩa của tôi. Cho biết chỉ tiết. Chi tiết tươi mới. Văn hay thường xuyên chạm vào đời sống. Văn tầm tầm chỉ phớt qua đời sống. Văn tồi thì hãm hiếp đòi sống rồi bỏ nàng đó cho ruồi.

tr: “Bir: Bunun gibi kitapların neden çok önemli olduğunu biliyor musun? Çünkü onlar nitelikliler. Peki nitelik sözcüğünün anlamı nedir? Bana göre dokusudur. Bu kitabın gözenekleri var. Özellikleri var. Bu kitap mikroskop altına girebilir. Camın altında sonsuz bir bollukla geçen bir yaşam bulursun. Ne kadar çok gözenek olursa, bir yaprak kâğıt üzerine her santimetrekare için doğrulukla kaydedilmiş yaşama ilişkin daha çok olur ve sen daha çok “yazınsal” olursun. Neyse, bu benim tarifim. Ayrıntıyı anlatmak. Yeni ayrıntıları. İyi yazarlar yaşama sık sık dokunurlar. Ortalama yazarlar üstüne hafifçe dokunup geçerler. Kötü olanlar ona tecavüz edip, leşini sineklere bırakır.

es: »Primera: ¿Sabe por qué libros como éste son tan importantes? Porque tienen calidad. Y, ¿qué significa la palabra calidad? Para mí, significa textura. Este libro tiene poros, tiene facciones. Este libro puede colocarse bajo el microscopio. A través de la lente encontraría vida, huellas del pasado en infinita profusión. Cuantos más poros, más detalles de la vida verídicamente registrados puede obtener de cada hoja de papel, cuanto más «literario» se vea. En todo caso, ésa es mi definición. Detalle revelador. Detalle reciente. Los buenos escultores tocan la vida a menudo. Los mediocres sólo pasan apresuradamente la mano por encima de ella. Los malos violan y la dejan por inútil.

vi_translation: "First: Do you know why books like these are so important? Because they have quality. And what does quality mean? To me, it means texture. This book has pores. It has features. This book can be put under a microscope. You will find life under the lens, flowing, endlessly abundant. The more pores there are, the more detailed the life on each square inch of paper that we can record, the more 'literate' you become. Anyway, that's my definition. Provide details. Fresh details. Good literature often touches life. Average literature merely brushes over life. Bad literature rapes life and leaves her for the flies.
tr_translation: “One: Do you know why books like this are so important? Because they are of high quality. So, what is the meaning of the word quality? To me, it is texture. This book has pores. It has features. This book can go under a microscope. Under the glass, you find a life passing with infinite abundance. The more pores there are, the more life accurately recorded per square centimeter on a sheet of paper, and the more 'literary' you become. Anyway, that's my definition. To describe the detail. New details. Good writers frequently touch life. Average writers touch it lightly and pass over it. Bad ones rape it and leave its corpse for the flies.
es_translation: »First: Do you know why books like this one are so important? Because they have quality. And, what does the word quality mean? To me, it means texture. This book has pores, it has features. This book can be placed under the microscope. Through the lens, you would find life, traces of the past in infinite profusion. The more pores, the more details of life truthfully recorded you can obtain from each sheet of paper, the more "literary" it looks. In any case, that is my definition. Revealing detail. Recent detail. Good sculptors often touch life. The mediocre ones just hurriedly pass their hand over it. The bad ones violate it and leave it useless.
Sesotho: 1 Na ua tseba hore na ke hobane'ng ha libuka tse kang tsena li le bohlokoa hakana? Hobane ba na le boleng. Boleng ba lentsoe bo bolela'ng? Ho 'na, ho bolela ho ba le bo-'m'ae. Buka ena e na le li-pores. E na le likarolo. Buka ena e ka tsamaea ka tlas'a microscope. U ne u tla fumana bophelo tlas'a khalase, phallela nakong e fetileng ka ho se feleng profusion. Ha li-pores tse ngata, lintlha tse ngotsoeng ka 'nete haholoanyane tsa bophelo ka lisekoere u ka fumana ka lakane ea pampiri, ho feta 'bongoli' u leng sona. Ena ke tlhaloso ea ka, leha ho le joalo. Bolella lintlha tse qaqileng. Lintlha tse ncha. Bangoli ba bangata ba tloaetse ho ama bophelo ba bona khafetsa. Li-mediocre li tsamaea ka letsoho la hae ka potlako. Ba mo khathatseha 'me ba mo siea bakeng sa lintsintsi.
Yorùbá: "Nọmba akọkọ: Ṣe o mọ idi ti awọn iwe bii eyi ṣe ṣe pataki? Nítorí wọ́n ní ojúlówó. Àti pé kí ni ìtumọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ náà túmọ̀ sí? Fún èmi ó túmọ̀ sí ìrísí. Ìwé yìí ní pores. O ni awọn ẹya ara ẹrọ. Ìwé yìí lè lọ lábẹ́ ẹ̀rọ arí-ohun-àìrí. Wà á rí ìgbésí ayé lábẹ́ gíláàsì náà, ṣíṣe àgbéjáde kọjá nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ìbàjẹ́ àìlópin. Bí àwọn pores bá ṣe pọ̀ sí i, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni àwọn àlàyé òtítọ́ nípa ìgbésí ayé fún square inch kan tí o lè rí lórí ìwé kan, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni o ṣe jẹ́ 'ìwé ìtàn' tó. Ìtumọ̀ mi nìyẹn, lọ́nàkọnà. Sọ àlàyé. Àlàyé tuntun. Àwọn òkọ̀wé gidi máa ń fọwọ́ kan ayé ní gbogbo ìgbà. Àwọn tí kò dára sáré gbé ọwọ́ rẹ̀ lé e lórí. Àwọn ẹni burúkú fipá bá a lòpọ̀ wọ́n sì fi í sílẹ̀ fún eṣinṣin.

No'u nei, e auraa parau teie. Te vai ra i roto i teie buka te mau tapa'o. Te vai ra to ' na mau tuhaa. E nehenehe teie buka e tuuhia i raro a'e i te hi'o faarahi. Rahi noa'tu to outou po'ipo'i, rahi noa'toa'tu to outou iteraa i te mau mea no ni'a i te oraraa, rahi noa'toa'tu to outou iteraa i te reira i ni'a i te hoê api parau, rahi noa'toa'tu to outou 'aperaa'. Maithili: "नंबर एक: की अहां जनैत छी जे एहि तरहक किताब एतेक महत्वपूर्ण किएक अछि? किएकि ओकर गुणवत्ता अछि। आ गुणवत्ता शब्दक अर्थ की अछि? हमरा लेल एकर अर्थ बनावट अछि। एहि किताब मे छिद्र अछि। एकर विशेषता अछि। ई किताब माइक्रोस्कोपक नीचा जा सकैत अछि। अहां कांच के नीचा जीवन पाबि सकैत छी, अनंत संलयन मे अतीत के प्रवाहित करैत छी। जतेक बेसी छिद्र, प्रति वर्ग इंच जीवनक विवरण अहाँ कागजक शीट पर ओतेक बेसी सत्यतापूर्वक दर्ज कऽ सकैत छी, अहाँ ओतेक बेसी 'साहित्यिक' होब। ई हमर परिभाषा अछि, वैसे भी। विस्तार सँ बता रहल अछि। ताजा विवरण। नीक लेखक जीवन के अक्सर छूबैत छथि। औसत दर्जाक लोक ओकरा पर झटपट हाथ चलबैत अछि। खराब लोक ओकर संग बलात्कार करैत अछि आ ओकरा मक्खी लेल छोड़ि दैत अछि।
Malagasy: Valiny: Fantatrao ve hoe nahoana no tena zava-dehibe ireo boky ireo? Satria manana kalitao izy ireo. Inona no dikan'ny teny hoe toetra? Ho ahy dia midika hoe soratra izany. Ity boky ity dia misy ny pores. Manana ny endri-javatra izy. Ity boky ity dia afaka mandeha eo ambanin'ny mikraoskaopy. Ho hitanao eo ambanin'ny fitaratra ny fiainana, izay mandeha amin'ny alalan'ny fikorisàna tsy manam-petra. Arakaraky ny maha-betsaka ny mason-koditra no maha-zava-dehibe kokoa ny antsipirihan'ny fiainana isaky ny santimetatra toradroa izay azonao atao amin'ny taratasy iray, arakaraka ny maha-'ara-bakiteny' anao kokoa. Izany no famaritana, na izany aza. Lazao amin'ny antsipirihany. Antsipiriany vaovao. Matetika, ny mpanoratra tsara dia mifandray amin'ny fiainana. Mihazakazaka haingana eo amboniny ireo olon-dratsy. Ny olon-dratsy dia manolana azy ary mamela azy ho any amin'ny lalitra.
Divehi (Dhivehi): "ނަމްބަރު ވަން: މިކަހަލަ ފޮތްތައް މިހާ މުހިންމު ވަނީ ކީއްވެކަން އެނގޭތަ؟ އެމީހުންގެ ކިބައިގައި ކޮލިޓީ ހުރުމުންނެވެ. އަދި ކޮލިޓީ މި ލަފުޒުގެ މާނައަކީ ކޮބައި ހެއްޔެވެ؟ އަޅުގަނޑަށް އޭގެ މާނައަކީ ޓެކްސްޗަރ. މި ފޮތުގައި ޕޯސްތައް އެބަހުއްޓެވެ. އޭގެ ސިފަތައް އެބަހުއްޓެވެ. މި ފޮތަކީ މައިކްރޮސްކޯޕްގެ ދަށަށް ދެވިދާނެ ފޮތެކެވެ. ބިއްލޫރިގަނޑުގެ ދަށުގައި ދިރުން ފެނި، އިންފިނިޓް ޕްރޮފިއުޝަންގައި ފާސްޓް ސްޓްރީމް ކޮށްލާނެއެވެ. ޕޯސްތައް ގިނަވާ ވަރަކަށް، ކޮންމެ އަކަ އިންޗިއަކަށް ދިރުންތަކުގެ ތެދުވެރިކަމާއެކު ރެކޯޑް ކުރެވިފައިވާ ތަފްޞީލުތައް ކަރުދާސްކޮޅަކުން ލިބޭ ވަރަކަށް ތިބާއަކީ "ލިޓަރަރީ" އެވެ. ކޮންމެ ގޮތެއް ވިޔަސް އެއީ އަޅުގަނޑުގެ މާނައެވެ. ތަފްޞީލުކޮށް ކިޔައިދިނުން. ތާޒާ ތަފްސީލެވެ. ރަނގަޅު ލިޔުންތެރިން ދިރިއުޅުމުގައި ވަރަށް ގިނައިން އަތްލައެވެ. މެދުފަންތީގެ މީހުން އެކަމަނާގެ މައްޗަށް އަވަސްއަވަހަށް އަތްދިއްކޮށްލިއެވެ. ނުބައި މީހުން އޭނާ ރޭޕްކޮށް މަކުނުތަކަށް ދޫކޮށްލައެވެ.

en: A great nuzzling gout of flame leapt out to lap at the books and knock them against the wall. He stepped into the bedroom and fired twice and the twin beds went up in a great simmering whisper, with more heat and passion and light than he would have supposed them to contain. He burnt the bedroom walls and the cosmetics chest because he wanted to change everything, the chairs, the tables, and in the dining-room the silverware and plastic dishes, everything that showed that he had lived here in this empty house with a strange woman who would forget him tomorrow, who had gone and quite forgotten him already, listening to her Seashell radio pour in on her and in on her as she rode across town, alone. And as before, it was good to burn, he felt himself gush out in the fire, snatch, rend, rip in half with flame, and put away the senseless problem. If there was no solution, well then now there was no problem, either. Fire was best for everything!

vi: Một dòng lửa tướng phụt ra xồ tới ngoạm những cuốn sách và đập chúng vào tường. Anh bước vào phòng ngủ mà phóng lửa hai lần, chiếc giường đôi liền bùng cháy phát ra tiếng xèo xèo nho nhỏ tuyệt vòi, với bao nhiêu là sức nóng và đam mê và ánh sáng, anh chưa hề nghĩ là trong chúng lại có thể có ngần ấy sức nóng và đam mê và ánh sáng. Anh đốt các bức tường phòng ngủ đốt tủ đồ mỹ phẩm vì anh muốn thay đổi mọi thứ, những cái ghế, những cái bàn, và trong phòng ăn thì anh đốt bộ đồ ăn bằng bạc và các đĩa nhựa, tất cả những gì cho thấy anh đã sống nơi đây trong căn nhà trống rỗng này với một người đàn bà xa lạ chỉ ngày mai thôi là sẽ quên anh, người đàn bà đã ra đi và đã gần quên anh rồi, đang nghe cái Radio vỏ Sò rót vào tai cô rót mãi vào tai cô trong khi cô ngồi xe băng ngang qua thành phố, một mình. Và cũng như trước, đốt thế này thật dễ chịu, anh cảm thấy bản thân mình phụt ra trong ngọn lửa, giằng, rứt, xé làm đôi cùng ngọn lửa, và diệt quách cái vấn đề vô nghĩa ấy đi. Nếu đã chẳng có giải pháp nào thì giờ cũng chẳng có vấn đề nào nốt. Lửa là tốt nhất cho mọi thứ!

tr: “Ateş!” Büyük bir ateş dili uzanarak kitapları yaladı ve onları karşı duvara fırlattı. Montag yatak odasına girdi, iki kere ateş etti ve ikiz yataklar büyük bir tıslamayla, onlarda bulunduğunu sandığından daha fazlı ısı, öfke ve ışıkla patlayarak havaya fırladılar. Yatak odasının duvarlarını, kozmetik kutusunu yaktı, çünkü her şeyi, iskemleleri, masaları ve yemek odasındaki gümüş eşyayı, plastik tabak çanağı, bir zamanlar burada, bu boş evde, kendisini yarın unutacak olan, gitmiş ve onu herhalde unutmaya başlamış olan, kulağındaki Deniz Kabuğu’nu dinleyen ve şehirde yalnız dolaşırken de radyosu kulağında olan, garip bir kadınla birlikte yaşamış olduğunu gösteren her şeyi değiştirmek istiyordu. Ve eskiden olduğu gibi, yakmak güzel bir şeydi, kendisini ateşin içinden fışkırıyormuş gibi, kavrayıcı kopartıcı, yırtıcı ve mantıksız sorunlardan uzak hissetti. Eğer bir çözüm yoksa, o zaman bir sorun da yok demekti. Ateş her sorun için en iyi çareydi!
tr_results: "title": "Fahrenheit 451","author": "Ray Bradbury"
es: —¡Fuego! Un chorro llameante salió desde la boquilla del aparato y golpeó los libros contra la pared. Montag entró en el dormitorio y disparó dos veces, y las camas gemelas se volatilizaron exhalando un susurro, con más calor, pasión y luz de las que él había supuesto que pudiesen contener. Montag quemó las paredes del dormitorio, el tocador, porque quería cambiarlo todo, las sillas, las mesas; y, en el comedor, los platos de plástico y de plata, todo lo que indicara que él había vivido allí, en aquella casa vacía, con una mujer desconocida que mañana le olvidaría, que se había marchado y le había olvidado ya por completo, escuchando su radio auricular mientras atravesaba la ciudad, sola. Y como antes, era bueno quemar. Montag se sintió borbotear en las llamas y el insensato problema fue arrebatado, destruido, dividido y ahuyentado. Si no había solución... Bueno, en tal caso, tampoco quedaría problema. ¡El fuego era lo mejor para todos!

vi_translation: A stream of fire burst out, rushing to devour the books and slam them against the wall. He stepped into the bedroom and shot fire twice, the double bed immediately burst into flames with a small sizzling sound, with so much heat and passion and light, he had never thought that there could be so much heat and passion and light in them. He burned the bedroom walls, burned the vanity because he wanted to change everything, the chairs, the tables, and in the dining room, he burned the silverware and the plastic plates, everything that showed he had lived here in this empty house with a strange woman who by tomorrow would forget him, the woman who had left and had nearly forgotten him already, listening to the Seashell Radio pouring into her ears, pouring endlessly into her ears as she sat in a car driving across the city, alone. And just like before, burning like this felt so pleasant, he felt himself burst out in the fire, tearing, wrenching, splitting in two with the fire, and completely annihilating that meaningless problem. If there was no solution, then now there was no problem either. Fire is the best for everything!
tr_translation: A large tongue of fire reached out, licking the books and hurling them against the opposite wall. Montag entered the bedroom, fired twice, and the twin beds, with a great hiss, exploded into the air with more heat, anger, and light than he had thought they contained. He burned the walls of the bedroom, the cosmetics box, because he wanted to change everything that showed he had once lived here, in this empty house, with a strange woman who would forget him tomorrow, who had left and probably already started to forget him, who listened to the Seashell in her ear and wandered alone in the city with her radio in her ear: the chairs, the tables, the silverware in the dining room, the plastic dishes. And as before, burning was a beautiful thing, he felt as if he were bursting forth from the fire, away from the grasping, tearing, predatory, and irrational problems. If there was no solution, then it meant there was no problem either. Fire was the best remedy for every problem!”
es_translation: A blazing jet shot out from the nozzle of the device and struck the books against the wall. Montag entered the bedroom and fired twice, and the twin beds vaporized, exhaling a whisper, with more heat, passion, and light than he had supposed they could contain. Montag burned the bedroom walls, the dresser, because he wanted to change everything, the chairs, the tables; and, in the dining room, the plastic and silver plates, everything that indicated he had lived there, in that empty house, with an unknown woman who would forget him tomorrow, who had already left and completely forgotten him, listening to her ear radio as she crossed the city, alone. And as before, it was good to burn. Montag felt himself bubbling in the flames and the senseless problem was snatched away, destroyed, divided, and driven away. If there was no solution... Well, in that case, there would be no problem either. Fire was the best for everyone!
Sesotho: ʻO ka hoʻokele ʻana i ka ʻike ʻana o ka hoʻokele a me ka hoʻokele ʻana i ka hoʻokele. A kena ka kamoreng ea ho robala 'me a thunya habeli' me betheng ea mafahla e ile ea nyoloha ka har'a sesepa se seholo, ka mocheso le cheseho le khanya ho feta kamoo a neng a ka nahana hore li na le tsona. O chesitse mabota a kamore ea ho robala le sefuba sa litlolo hobane o ne a batla ho fetola ntho e ngoe le e ngoe, litulo, litafole le ka kamoreng ea ho jela lijana tsa silevera le tsa polasetiki, tsohle tse bonts'ang hore o ne a lula mona ntlong ena e se nang letho le mosali ea makatsang ea neng a tla mo lebala hosane, ea neng a tsoile 'me a mo lebala haholo, ea neng a se a ntse a mo lebala,  Ka mor'a moo, ha a ntse a tsamaea ka har'a hae, o ile a tsamaea ka har'a hae a le mong, 'me ka mor'a hae, o ne a ntse a tsamaea ka har'a hae. Joaloka pele, ho ne ho le molemo ho chesa, o ile a ikutloa a phorosela mollong, hloibiloang, rend, rip ka halofo ka lelakabe, 'me a tlosa bothata bo se nang kelello. Haeba ho ne ho se na tharollo, joale ho ne ho se na bothata. Mollo o molemo ka ho fetisisa bakeng sa ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe!
Yorùbá: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ iná ńlá fò jáde láti yí àwọn ìwé náà padà kí ó sì gbá wọn mọ́ ògiri. Ó wọ inú yàrá ìbùsùn ó sì yìnbọn lẹ́ẹ̀mejì àwọn ibùsùn ìbejì náà sì gòkè lọ pẹ̀lú ọ̀rọ̀ kéékèèké ńlá, pẹ̀lú ooru àti ìfẹ́ àti ìmọ́lẹ̀ ju bí ó ṣe yẹ kí wọ́n dá dúró lọ. Ó jó ògiri yàrá àti àyà ohun ìkunra nítorí pé ó fẹ́ pààrọ̀ gbogbo nkan, àga, tábìlì, àti nínú yàrá ìjẹun ohun èlò fàdákà àti àwọn oúnjẹ ṣiṣu, gbogbo ohun tí ó fi hàn pé ó ti gbé níbí nínú ilé òfìfo yìí pẹ̀lú obìnrin àjèjì tí yóò gbàgbé rẹ̀ lọ́la, ẹni tí ó ti lọ tí ó sì ti gbàgbé rẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀,  Gbígbọ́ rédíò Seashell rẹ̀ tú sórí rẹ̀ àti lórí rẹ̀ bí ó ṣe ń gun ọkọ̀ kọjá ìlú, nìkan. Gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ti tẹ́lẹ̀, ó dára láti jóná, ó ní ìmọ̀lára pé ara rẹ̀ ń jáde nínú iná náà, gbígbé, rend, rip ní ìdajì pẹ̀lú iná, ó sì fi ìṣòro àìmọ̀kan náà sílẹ̀. Tí kò bá sí ọ̀nà àbáyọ, ó dáa nígbà náà kò sí ìṣòro, náà. Iná dára jù fún gbogbo nkan!

E mai mutaa ihora, e mea maitai ia tutui i te auahi, ua ite oia ia ' na iho i te ou'araa i roto i te auahi, i te haruraa, i te anehaa, i te afaraa o te auahi, e i te faaoreraa i te fifi maamaa. Mai te peu e aita e ravea, aita atoa ïa e fifi i teie nei. Mea maitai a'e te auahi no te mau mea atoa!
Maithili: लौक एकटा पैघ चमकैत गाउट किताब पर गोद लेबाक लेल कूदि गेल आ ओकरा देवालसँ टकरा देलक। ओ बेडरूममे पैर रखलनि आ दू बेर गोली चलओलनि आ जुड़वा बिछौना एकटा पैघ उबलैत फुसफुसाहटमे ऊपर चलि गेल, जाहिमे बेसी गर्मी आ जुनून आ प्रकाशक सङ्ग जतेक ओ मानैत छलाह। ओ बेडरूमक दीवार आ सौंदर्य प्रसाधनक छाती जरि देलनि किएक तँ ओ सब किछु बदलय चाहैत छलाह, कुर्सी, टेबुल, आ भोजन-कक्षमे चाँदीक बर्तन आ प्लास्टिकक बर्तन, सब किछु जे देखबैत छल जे ओ एहि खाली घरमे एकटा अजीब स्त्रीक संग रहैत छलाह जे काल्हि ओकरा बिसरि जायत, जे जा चुकल छल आ ओकरा पहिनेसँ बिसरि गेल छल।  जखन ओ अकेले शहर पार करैत छलीह तखन हुनका पर आ हुनका पर अपन सीशेल रेडियो बहैत सुनैत छलीह। आ पहिने जकाँ जरि जेनाइ नीक छल, ओ महसूस कयलनि जे आगि मे अपना के बाहर निकालि लेलक, छीनि लेलक, तोड़ि देलक, लौ सँ आधा चीर लेलक, आ मूर्खतापूर्ण समस्या के दूर कऽ देलक। जँ कोनो समाधान नहि छल, तखन आब कोनो समस्या नहि छल। आगि सभ चीज के लेल सबसं बढ़िया छल।
Malagasy: Nisy lelafo lehibe iray nitsambikina teo am-pofoan'ireo boky ary nandondona azy ireo teo amin'ny rindrina. Nodorany ny rindrin'ny efitrano fatoriana sy ny tratran'ny kosmetika satria te-hanova ny zava-drehetra, ny seza, ny latabatra, ary ao amin'ny efitrano fisakafoana ny fitaovana volafotsy sy ny lovia plastika, ny zavatra rehetra izay nampiseho fa nonina teto amin'ity trano foana ity niaraka tamin'ny vehivavy hafahafa izay hanadino azy rahampitso, izay efa lasa ary efa nanadino azy sahady,  Nihaino ny onjam-peony Seashell nirotsaka taminy sy tao aminy rehefa nandeha irery namakivaky ny tanàna izy. Ary toy ny teo aloha, tsara ny nandoro azy, nahatsapa ny tenany ho nirehidrehitra tao anaty afo izy, nilentika, nipitika, nandrovitra ny antsasany tamin'ny lelafo, ary nanaisotra ilay olana tsy misy dikany. Raha tsy misy ny vahaolana, dia tsy misy olana ihany koa amin'izao fotoana izao. Ny afo no tsara indrindra ho an'ny zavatra rehetra!
Divehi (Dhivehi): އަލިފާންގަނޑުގެ ބޮޑު އަލިފާންގަނޑެއް ފޮތްތައް ތަޅައިގެން ގޮސް ފާރުގައި ތަޅައިގަތެވެ. ކޮޓަރިއަށް ވަދެ ދެފަހަރަކު ބަޑިޖަހާލުމާއެކު ދެ އެނދު މައްޗަށް ދިޔައީ އޭނާ ހީކުރި ވަރަށްވުރެ ހޫނުކަމާއި ޖޯޝާއި އަލިކަމުގެ ސަބަބުން ނެވެ. ކޮޓަރީގެ ފާރުތަކާއި ކޮސްމެޓިކްސް ބުރަކަށި އޭނާ އަންދާލީ ހުރިހާ ކަމެއް ބަދަލުކުރަން ބޭނުންވާތީ އާއި ގޮނޑީތަކާއި މޭޒުތަކާއި ޑައިނިންރޫމްގައި ހުރި ސިލްވާވެއާ އާއި ޕްލާސްޓިކް ޑިޝްތައް ބަދަލުކުރަން ބޭނުންވާތީ އެވެ. މި ހުސްގޭގައި އޭނާ ދިރިއުޅެމުން އައީ މާދަމާ އޭނާ މަތިން ހަނދާން ނައްތާލާނެ އާދަޔާ ހިލާފު އަންހެނަކާއެކުކަން އެނގެއެވެ.  އެކަމަނާގެ ސީޝެލް ރޭޑިޔޯ އަޑުއައްސަވައި، އެކަމަނާ ގެ އަރިހަށް ވަދެވަޑައިގަންނަވައެވެ. އެކަމަނާ އެކަނިމާއެކަނި ރަށުގެ އެކި ކަންކޮޅުތަކުގައި ދަތުރުކުރެއްވިއެވެ. އަދި ކުރިންވެސް ފަދައިން، އަލިފާންރޯވެ، އަލިފާންގަނޑުގެ ތެރެޔަށް ވަދެ، ފޭރިގަތުމާއި، ފަޅައިގެން ގޮސް، އަލިފާންގަނޑުން ދެބައިކުޅަ އެއްބަޔަށް ފަޅައިގެން ގޮސް، ބޭކާރު މައްސަލަ ފިލުވާލިކަމުގެ އިޙްސާސް އޭނާއަށް ކުރެވުނެވެ. އެކަމަށް ހައްލެއް ނުލިބުނަސް މިހާރު އެއްވެސް މައްސަލައެއް ނެތެވެ. ހުރިހާ ކަމަކަށް ވެސް އެންމެ ރަނގަޅީ އަލިފާނެވެ!

en: And then he came to the parlour where the great idiot monsters lay asleep with their white thoughts and their snowy dreams. And he shot a bolt at each of the three blank walls and the vacuum hissed out at him. The emptiness made an even emptier whistle, a senseless scream. He tried to think about the vacuum upon which the nothingness had performed, but he could not. He held his breath so the vacuum could not get into his lungs. He cut off its terrible emptiness, drew back, and gave the entire room a gift of one huge bright yellow flower of burning. The fire-proof plastic sheath on everything was cut wide and the house began to shudder with flame.

Anh cố nghĩ về khoảng chân không mà trên đó cái hư vô vừa mới diễn bày, nhưng không được. Anh nín thở sao cho chân không đừng lọt vào phổi mình. Anh cắt rời cái trống trơn khủng khiếp của nó, lùi lại, làm cả căn phòng bừng lên một đóa hoa vàng vĩ đại sáng lòa rực cháy, vỏ nhựa chống cháy trên mọi thứ bị rạch toang và cả căn nhà bắt đầu rung chuyển vì lửa.

es: Y luego, Montag entró en el salón, donde los estúpidos monstruos yacían dormidos con sus pensamientos blancos y sus sueños nebulosos. Y lanzó una andanada a cada una de las tres paredes desnudas y el vacío pareció sisear contra él. La desnudez produjo un siseo mayor, un chillido insensato. Montag trató de pensar en el vacío sobre el que había actuado la nada, pero no pudo. Contuvo el aliento para que el vacío no penetrara en sus pulmones. Eliminó aquella terrible soledad, retrocedió y dirigió una enorme y brillante llamarada amarillenta a toda la habitación. La cubierta de plástico ignífugo que había sobre todos los objetos, quedó deshecha y la casa empezó a estremecerse con las llamas.

vi_translation: Then he stepped into the living room where the giant ignorant monsters were dozing with pale thoughts and snow-covered dreams. And he fired a stream of flames at each of the three white walls, and the vacuum hissed back at him. The empty space created an even more hollow whistle, a meaningless scream. He tried to think about the vacuum on which the nothingness had just been displayed, but he couldn't. He held his breath so that the vacuum wouldn't enter his lungs. He cut through its terrifying emptiness, stepped back, making the entire room burst into a giant, blazing yellow flower, the fire-resistant plastic on everything tearing apart, and the whole house began to shake from the fire.
tr_translation: Then, he came to the hall where the big, stupid monsters were sleeping with their white thoughts and snowy dreams. He sent a short lightning bolt to each of the three empty walls, and the void hissed back at him. The void had formed a more empty whistle, an illogical scream. He tried to think about the void on which nothingness performed its art, but he couldn't. He held his breath to prevent the void from entering his lungs. He ended the terrible loneliness of the room by stepping back and sending a large, bright yellow fire flower to the entire room. The fire-resistant plastic sheet covering everything tore apart, and the house began to shake in flames.
es_translation: And then, Montag entered the living room, where the stupid monsters lay asleep with their blank thoughts and nebulous dreams. And he launched a volley at each of the three bare walls and the void seemed to hiss against him. The bareness produced a greater hiss, a senseless scream. Montag tried to think of the void upon which nothing had acted, but he couldn't. He held his breath so that the void wouldn't penetrate his lungs. He eliminated that terrible loneliness, stepped back and directed a huge and bright yellowish flame at the whole room. The fireproof plastic cover that was over all the objects disintegrated and the house began to tremble with the flames.
Sesotho: Eaba o tla parlour moo litonanahali tse kholo tsa leoatla li robetseng ka menahano ea tsona e tšoeu le litoro tsa bona tsa lehloa. 'Me o ile a fana ka makhasi a mararo, 'me a mo laela hore a mo. Lerata le ile la etsa lerata le leholo, le lerata le se nang kelello. O ile a leka ho nahana ka lephaka leo ho lona ho neng ho se letho le entseng, empa o ne a sa khone. O ile a tšoara phefumoloho ea hae e le hore lephaka le ne le sa khone ho kena matšoafong a hae. O ile a khaola lefeela la eona le tšabehang, a hula morao, 'me a fa kamore eohle mpho ea palesa e le' ngoe e khanyang e khanyang e khanyang ea ho chesa. Sheath ea bopaki ba mollo ho tsohle e ne e khaotsoe ka bophara mme ntlo e qala ho shudder ka lelakabe.
Yorùbá: Lẹ́yìn náà ó wá sí yàrá ìgbafẹ́ níbi tí àwọn ẹranko òmùgọ̀ ńlá náà ti sùn pẹ̀lú èrò funfun wọn àti àlá yìnyín wọn. Ó sì yìnbọn sí ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan àwọn ògiri òfìfo mẹ́ta àti pé òfo náà yọ sí i. Òfìfo náà ṣe fèrè òfìfo, igbe tí kò ní ọgbọ́n. Ó gbìyànjú láti ronú nípa òfo tí ohunkóhun náà ti ṣe, ṣùgbọ́n kò lè ṣe é. Ó dá èémí rẹ̀ dúró kí òfo náà má bàa wọ inú ẹ̀dọ̀fóró rẹ̀. Ó gé òfìfo burúkú rẹ̀ kúrò, ó fà sẹ́yìn, ó sì fún gbogbo yàrá náà ní ẹ̀bùn òdòdó aláwọ̀ òféèfé ńlá kan tí ó tàn láti jó. Sheath ṣiṣu tí kò ní ẹ̀rí iná lórí gbogbo nkan ni wọ́n gé káàkiri ilé náà sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní yọ̀ pẹ̀lú iná.
Setswana (Tswana): Morago ga moo, ba ne ba ya kwa go bone ba ba neng ba robetse ka dipono tsa bone tse di bogale le ditoro tsa bone tse di sa siamang. O ne a tshwenya mo leboteng lengwe le lengwe le le lengwe le le lengwe le le nang le ditshika tse tharo, mme a tswa mo go ene. Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go na le modumo o o maswe le go feta, go na le modumo o o se nang tlhaloganyo. O ne a leka go akanya ka gore ga go na sepe se a neng a se dira, mme o ne a sa kgone. 'O ne a ywêna mo a neng a sa kgone go tsêna mo makgwêng' - He got the breath so that the vacuum can not get into her lungs 'O ne a kgaola tôtô ya gagwê e e bogale' - He drew back back and give the whole room a gift of a big bright yellow flower of burns Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go na le sengwe le sengwe se se neng se tletse mme ntlo e ne ya simolola go fisa ka molelo.
Reo Tahiti (Tahitian): E i muri iho, ua haere atura oia i te parlour i reira te mau animala taehae rahi e taoto ai e to ratou mau mana'o uouo e ta ratou mau moemoeâ hiona. E ua pupuhi a'era oia i te hoê pupuhi i nia i na patu e toru atoa ra e ua pee atura te aore i nia ia ' na. No te faufaa ore, ua faaroo - atoa - hia te hoê hi'o, te hoê tuô maamaa. Ua tamata oia i te feruri i te faufaa ore o te ohipa i ravehia, aita râ i nehenehe ia'na. Ua tape'a noa oia i to'na aho ia ore te hutiraa aho ia ô i roto i to'na mahaha. Ua tâpû oia i to ' na faufaa ore riaria mau, ua huti mai, e ua horoa ' tu i roto i te piha taatoa i te hoê ô o te hoê tiare rahi rearea anaana. Ua tâpûhia te mau ofa'i pupuhi i ni'a i te mau mea atoa e ua haamata te fare i te ura i te auahi.
Maithili: आ तखन ओ पार्लर आबि गेलाह जतय पैघ मूर्ख राक्षस अपन उज्जर विचार आ अपन बर्फीला सपनाक संग सुतल छल। आ ओ तीनटा खाली देवालमे सँ प्रत्येक पर एकटा बोल्ट मारलक आ निर्वात हुनका दिस झपटि गेल। खालीपन एकटा आओर खाली सीटी बनौलक, एकटा मूर्खतापूर्ण चीख। ओ ओहि निर्वातक विषयमे सोचबाक प्रयास कयलनि जाहि पर शून्यता प्रदर्शन कयलक, मुदा ओ नहि कऽ सकल। ओ अपन सांस रोकि लेलनि जाहिसँ निर्वात हुनक फेफड़ामे नहि जा सकय। ओ एकर भयानक खालीपनकेँ काटि पाछू खींचि लेलनि आ पूरा कोठरीकेँ जरबाक एकटा विशाल चमकदार पीयर फूलक उपहार देलनि। सभ चीज पर अग्निरोधी प्लास्टिकक आवरण चौड़ा काटि देल गेल आ घर ज्वालासँ कांपय लागल।
Malagasy: Ary avy eo dia tonga tao amin'ny trano fandraisam-bahiny izy izay natory ireo biby goavam-be adala niaraka tamin'ny eritreriny fotsy sy ny nofinofiny feno ranomandry. 3Notafihin'i Salomona, Etama-Sobà, ka azony. Ny fahabangana dia nahatonga ny feo tsy misy dikany, hiaka tsy misy dikany. Niezaka nieritreritra momba ny banga izay nanaovan'ilay tsy misy na inona na inona izy, saingy tsy afaka. Nofihininy ny fofonainy mba tsy ho tafiditra ao amin'ny havokavony ilay banga. Notapahiny ny fahabangany mahatsiravina, dia niverina izy ary nanome ny efitrano iray manontolo ny fanomezana voninkazo mavo lehibe iray mamirapiratra. Notapahina ny talantalana plastika tsy misy afo teo amin'ny zava-drehetra ary nanomboka nirehidrehitra tamin'ny afo ny trano.
Divehi (Dhivehi): ދެން އޭނާ އައީ ބޮޑު އިޑިއަޓް މޮންސްޓާސް އެމީހުންގެ ހުދު ވިސްނުމާއި އެމީހުންގެ ސްނޯގަދަ ހުވަފެންތަކާއެކު ނިދާފައި އޮތް ޕާލަރަށެވެ. އަދި ހުސްތިން ފާރުގެ ތެރެއިން ކޮންމެ ފާރަކަށް ބޯލްޓެއް ގޮއްވާލުމާއެކު ހުސްކަން އޭނައާއި ދިމާއަށް ވެރިވެގެން ދިޔައެވެ. އެ ހުސްކަމުން އެއަށްވުރެ ވެސް ހުސް ވިސްލްއެއް، ބޭކާރު ހަޅޭއްލަވައިގަތެވެ. އެ ހުސްކަން އަދާކުރި ހުސްކަމާ މެދު ވިސްނާލަން އޭނާ މަސައްކަތް ކުރި ނަމަވެސް އޭނާއަށް އެކަން ނުކުރެވުނެވެ. ފުއްޕާމޭގެ ތެރެއަށް ހުސްކަން ނުވަންނާނެހެން ނޭވާ ހިފަހައްޓާލިއެވެ. އެތަނުގެ ނުރައްކާތެރި ހުސްކަން ކަނޑާލުމަށްފަހު ފަހަތަށް ޖެހިލުމަށްފަހު މުޅި ކޮޓަރިއަށް އަލިފާނުގެ އަލިގަދަ ރަތްކުލައިގެ ބޮޑު ފުޅަނދެއްގެ ހަދިޔާއެއް ދިނެވެ. ހުރިހާ އެއްޗެއްގައި ހުރި އަލިފާން ނިއްވާ ޕްލާސްޓިކް ޝީތް ފުޅާކޮށް ކަނޑާލުމާއެކު ގޭތެރެ އަލިފާންގަނޑުން ތެޅެން ފެށިއެވެ.

en: They turned, their faces like blanched meat, streaming sweat; he beat their heads, knocking off their helmets and bringing them down on themselves. They fell and lay without moving.

vi_translation: They turned around, their faces pale as bleached meat, drenched in sweat; he struck them on the head, knocking off their helmet and throwing them down. They fell down and lay motionless.
tr_translation: They turned around, their faces were like pieces of white flesh and they were sweating constantly. He struck them on their heads and knocked them to the ground. They fell and lay still.
es_translation: Both obeyed, their faces completely discolored and damp with sweat; Montag took off their helmets and struck them on the head. Both fell unconscious. Both lay still and motionless.

en: He ran steadily for six blocks, in the alley, and then the alley opened out on to a wide empty thoroughfare ten lanes wide. It seemed like a boatless river frozen there in the raw light of the high white arc-lamps; you could drown trying to cross it, he felt; it was too wide, it was too open. It was a vast stage without scenery, inviting him to run across, easily seen in the blazing illumination, easily caught, easily shot down.

es: Montag corrió sin detenerse durante seis manzanas, siguiendo el callejón. Y, después, éste se abrió sobre una amplia avenida, ancha como seis pistas. «A la cruda luz de las lámparas de arco parecía un río sin barcas; había el peligro de ahogarse tratando de cruzarla», pensó Montag. Era demasiado ancha, demasiado abierta. Era un enorme escenario sin decorados, que le invitaban a atravesarlo corriendo. Con la brillante iluminación era fácil de descubrir, de alcanzar, de eliminar.

vi_translation: He ran evenly along six blocks in the alley until the alley opened up to a wide ten-lane highway. It was like a river without boats, frozen in the harsh light of the glaring white curved lamps hanging high; if he tried to cross, he might sink, he felt; it was too wide, it was too empty. It was a vast stage without scenery, inviting him to run across, easily visible in the bright light, easily caught, easily shot down.
tr_translation: He ran six blocks down the narrow street and then the street opened up into a main avenue, at least ten streets wide and completely empty. Under the harsh light of the high arc lamps, the avenue looked like a frozen, boatless river. It felt to him as if he would drown if he tried to cross it; it was too wide and too open. It was like a large stage without scenery, provoking him to run across it, where he could easily be seen, easily caught, easily shot under the bright light.
es_translation: Montag ran without stopping for six blocks, following the alley. And then, it opened onto a wide avenue, as wide as six lanes. “In the harsh light of the arc lamps, it looked like a river without boats; there was the danger of drowning while trying to cross it,” Montag thought. It was too wide, too open. It was a huge stage without scenery, inviting him to run across it. With the bright lighting, it was easy to discover, to reach, to eliminate.
Sesotho: O ile a matha ka mokhoa o tsitsitseng bakeng sa li-block tse tšeletseng, 'me ka mor'a moo, alley e ile ea bula ka bophara bo se nang letho ka bophara bo se nang letho. E ne e tšoana le noka e se nang sekepe e batang moo leseli le khanyang la mabone a phahameng a tšoeu; O ka leka ho e tšela, o ikutloa; E ne e le sephara haholo, e butsoe haholo. E ne e le sethala se seholo se se nang litšoantšo, se mo mema hore a mathe ka mose, a bonoa habonolo maboneng a tukang, a ts'oaroa habonolo, a thunya habonolo.

en: What about those lights there? Once you started walking you'd have to gauge how fast those beetles could make it down here. Well, how far was it to the other curb? It seemed like a hundred yards. Probably not a hundred, but figure for that anyway, figure that with him going very slowly, at a nice stroll, it might take as much as thirty seconds, forty seconds to walk all the way. The beetles? Once started, they could leave three blocks behind them in about fifteen seconds. So, even if halfway across he started to run . . . ?

es: ¿Qué eran aquellas luces? Una vez se empezaba a andar, había que calcular cuánto tardarían aquellos vehículos en llegar hasta él. Bueno, ¿a qué distancia quedaba el otro bordillo? Al parecer, a un centenar de metros. Probablemente, no eran cien, pero mejor calcula, eso, puesto que él andaba lentamente, con paso tranquilo, y quizá, necesitase treinta segundos, cuarenta segundos para recorrer la distancia. ¿Los vehículos? Una vez en marcha, podían recorrer tres manzanas en unos quince segundos. De modo que, incluso si a mitad de la travesía empezase a correr...

vi_translation: What are those lights? Once we start moving, we have to gauge how quickly those beetle cars can get here. Well, how far is it to the other side of the curb? It seems like it's almost a hundred meters away. Maybe not a hundred, but let's say it is, let's say if you walk very slowly, leisurely, it might take about thirty seconds, forty seconds to cover that distance. Those cars? Once they start, they can cover three blocks in about fifteen seconds- So, what if you start running halfway across...?
tr_translation: What about the lights over there? Once you started walking, you also had to calculate how quickly those bugs could get here. Alright, how far is the opposite sidewalk? It looks about a hundred meters away. Maybe not exactly a hundred, but assume it is, and if you go very slowly, like a leisurely stroll, it would take about thirty seconds, and crossing the whole way would take forty seconds. The bugs? Once they start moving, they leave three blocks behind in about fifteen seconds. So, even if you start running to cross the road and get halfway?
es_translation: What were those lights? Once he started walking, he had to calculate how long it would take for those vehicles to reach him. Well, how far was the other curb? Apparently, about a hundred meters. Probably not a hundred, but better to estimate that, since he walked slowly, with a calm step, and might need thirty seconds, forty seconds to cover the distance. The vehicles? Once in motion, they could cover three blocks in about fifteen seconds. So, even if he started running halfway across...

Malagasy: Ahoana ny amin'ireo jiro ireo? Raha vao manomboka mandeha an-tongotra ianao dia tsy maintsy mandrefy ny hafainganam-pandehan'ireo bibikely ireo eto. Hatraiza ny halaviran'ny fetra hafa? en: Would he have time for a speech? As the Hound seized him, in view of ten or twenty or thirty million people, mightn't he sum up his entire life in the last week in one single phrase or a word that would stay with them long after the. Hound had turned, clenching him in its metal-plier jaws, and trotted off in darkness, while the camera remained stationary, watching the creature dwindle in the distance--a splendid fade-out! What could he say in a single word, a few words, that would sear all their faces and wake them up?

es: ¿Tendría tiempo para hablar cuando el Sabueso lo cogiera, a la vista de diez, veinte o treinta millones de personas?, ¿no podría resumir lo que había sido su vida durante la última semana con una sola frase o una palabra que permaneciera con ellas mucho después de que el Sabueso se hubiese vuelto, sujetándolo con sus mandíbulas de metal, para alejarse en la oscuridad, mientras la cámara permanecía quieta, enfocando al aparato que iría empequeñeciéndose a lo lejos, para ofrecer un final espléndido? ¿Qué podría decir en una sola palabra, en unas pocas palabras que dejara huella en todos sus rostros y les hiciera despertar?
